TopicTitle: The most frequently used words on KSP reddit

Articles.Content:
A user called 'Iamsodarncool' on /r/KerbalSpaceProgram posted the following image:

Yeah, it's Reddit not us, but I believe the local one wouldn't be much different. Too bad I have no clue how to extract such data from this forum, otherwise I would have made a similar graphic out of it.

But it's so cool.

They must have put a bit more thought into that, rather than just pointing a tool at the site.  This tool is pretty good - http://www.infocaptor.com/bubble-my-page, it will read a web page and create a bubble chart of the most frequently used words, but the problem is that if you just point it at something like this forum it sees the most common words as the words on buttons, and it also doesn't follow links on the page.  So you'd need to modify it to ignore the forums framework and just focus on content and make it follow links.

If you used another method of fetching the raw content then you could just dump that text into this tool which does a quite nice world cloud based from a block of text. https://www.jasondavies.com/wordcloud/
(both tools built using the awesome D3.data javascript graphical library).

Here's the word cloud it makes using this text I've just written as the content, how meta

(clearly I need to stop saying "just" so often)

18 minutes ago, katateochi said:

They must have put a bit more thought into that, rather than just pointing a tool at the site.

That's exactly what they did. But that tool is written for subreddits, and I can't just point it to a random forum software expecting it to follow links.
Just gone bong eyed trying to spot the words struts boosters and moar............
Aww...A funny thing would be if the big words ended up spelling 'When the next version will be released?"

18 minutes ago, BloodDusk said:

Aww...A funny thing would be if the big words ended up spelling 'When the next version will be released?"

S O O N

Please apply your own words...

Mine are often along the lines of. S**t. Oooh. Ooh. Noooo!
